intro: Glinus sessiliflorus, commonly known as the sessile-flower glinus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Glinus sessiliflorus is also known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
